edu.nd.darts.cimon
Interface ExpressionNode

All Known Implementing Classes:
AndNode, ConditionNode, CoordinateNode, OrNode
public interface ExpressionNode

Node within a ConditionTree. Node represents a conditional expression as provided by the client in an event monitoring request or a conditional monitor. This interface is implemented by the different forms of nodes: OR, AND, condition, and coordinate. Each node maintains a state, when true it means that the expression represented by the subtree rooted at this node is true.

Author:
darts
See Also:
AndNode, OrNode, ConditionNode, CoordinateNode

Method Detail

triggered

boolean triggered(ExpressionNode node)
Node has been triggered, representing that its state, or one if its child nodes' state, has been set to true. For leaf nodes, the trigger will come from the metric monitoring agent, and the passed value will be null. Trigger may be for a registered anti-condition. Leaf nodes must determine if trigger results in state change to true or false based on current state, since metric monitoring agent is not aware if registered monitor is an anti-condition. For interior nodes, the passed value is the child node that issued the trigger.

Parameters:
node - child node whose state changed to true (null if current node is leaf node)
Returns:
true if this trigger causes state of entire ConditionTree to change to true, false otherwise

untrigger

void untrigger(ExpressionNode node)
Issued by child node whose state has changed to false. This call should only be received by interior nodes (AND/OR nodes).

Parameters:
node - child node whose state changed to false

activate

void activate()
Begin actively monitoring the condition or subtree. For leaf nodes, register the condition with the metric monitoring agent. For interior OrNode, activate both child nodes. For interior AndNode, activate one child node. Other child node may be left inactive until first becomes true, using boolean short- circuit analysis to reduce metrics which must be actively monitored at once.

deactivate

void deactivate()
Stop actively monitoring the condition or subtree. For leaf nodes, unregister the condition with the metric monitoring agent. For interior nodes, deactivate child nodes. This allows resource savings by deactivating sub-branches of the tree based on boolean expression short-circuit analysis.

getCost

long getCost()
Return cost of monitoring this condition or subtree. Cost should be representative of the resource costs of monitoring these conditions.

Returns:
resource cost of monitoring this condition or subtree

clear

void clear()
Empty sub-tree rooted at this node. Used for clean-up to allow for garbage collection.

setParent

void setParent(ExpressionNode node)
Set parent node. This must be done after instantiation, since child nodes are generated before parents in the parsing process of event expressions.

Parameters:
node - parent node (null if this node is root of tree)

getHandler

Handler getHandler()
Returns link to event handler provided by NDroidService. This allows all actions related to event trees to be performed on a separate handler to provided synchronization.

Returns:
event handler used for all event tree activities
